habitats.name: Tropical Rainforest
habitats.description: Lush, dense forests with high rainfall and diverse flora and fauna.

habitats.name: Savanna
habitats.description: Grassy plains with scattered trees, home to large herbivores and predators.

habitats.name: Coral Reef
habitats.description: Underwater ecosystems with colorful corals and a variety of marine life.

habitats.name: Desert
habitats.description: Arid regions with low precipitation, adapted to extreme heat and drought.

habitats.name: Mangrove Forest
habitats.description: Coastal wetlands with salt-tolerant trees, vital for coastal protection.

habitats.name: Grassland
habitats.description: Wide open spaces with grasses, home to grazing mammals and birds.

habitats.name: Freshwater Wetland
habitats.description: Marshes, swamps, and bogs with abundant aquatic plants and wildlife.

habitats.name: Arctic Tundra
habitats.description: Cold, treeless regions with permafrost, inhabited by hardy mammals and birds.

habitats.name: Mountainous Region
habitats.description: High-altitude areas with diverse ecosystems, including alpine meadows.

habitats.name: Estuary
habitats.description: Transitional zones where rivers meet the sea, rich in nutrients and biodiversity.

habitats.name: Boreal Forest
habitats.description: Coniferous forests in cold northern regions with diverse wildlife.

habitats.name: Mediterranean Scrubland
habitats.description: Dry, shrub-covered landscapes with unique plant and animal species.

habitats.name: Freshwater Lake
habitats.description: Large inland bodies of freshwater, supporting aquatic life.

habitats.name: Tropical Dry Forest
habitats.description: Seasonal forests in tropical regions with distinct wet and dry seasons.

habitats.name: Polar Ice Cap
habitats.description: Frozen regions at the Earth's poles, inhabited by polar bears and seals.

habitats.name: Swamp
habitats.description: Waterlogged areas with standing water and dense vegetation.

habitats.name: Algal Bloom
habitats.description: Temporary overgrowths of algae in bodies of water.

habitats.name: Volcanic Island
habitats.description: Islands formed by volcanic activity, home to unique species.

habitats.name: Kelp Forest
habitats.description: Underwater ecosystems with tall kelp plants, supporting marine life.

habitats.name: Steppe
habitats.description: Grasslands with low precipitation and seasonal temperature extremes.

habitats.name: Freshwater Pond
habitats.description: Small bodies of freshwater, often home to frogs and aquatic insects.

habitats.name: Temperate Rainforest
habitats.description: Rainforests with moderate climates, lush vegetation, and abundant rainfall.

habitats.name: Mudflat
habitats.description: Intertidal areas of mud and silt, important for shorebirds and mollusks.

habitats.name: Cave
habitats.description: Underground chambers and tunnels inhabited by specialized creatures.

habitats.name: Canyon
habitats.description: Deep, narrow valleys with unique microclimates and biodiversity.

habitats.name: Rocky Shore
habitats.description: Coastal areas with rocky terrain, supporting intertidal species.

habitats.name: Deciduous Forest
habitats.description: Forests with trees that shed leaves seasonally, home to diverse wildlife.

habitats.name: Prairie
habitats.description: Vast grasslands with fertile soil, once home to bison herds.

habitats.name: Salt Flat
habitats.description: Dried-up lake beds with salt deposits, often devoid of vegetation.

habitats.name: Tropical Wetland
habitats.description: Wetlands in tropical regions with high rainfall and biodiversity.

habitats.name: Cape
habitats.description: Coastal headlands and promontories, offering nesting sites for birds.

habitats.name: Oasis
habitats.description: Desert water sources with lush vegetation and wildlife.

habitats.name: Mud Volcano
habitats.description: Volcanic landscapes with mud eruptions, home to specialized life forms.

habitats.name: Artificial Reef
habitats.description: Human-made structures submerged in the sea, supporting marine life.

habitats.name: Tidal Pool
habitats.description: Small pools of seawater left behind during low tide, teeming with life.

habitats.name: Agricultural Field
habitats.description: Managed landscapes used for farming, impacting local ecosystems.

habitats.name: Floodplain
habitats.description: Low-lying areas near rivers prone to periodic flooding.

habitats.name: Thermal Vent
habitats.description: Underwater geothermal vents with unique chemosynthetic ecosystems.

habitats.name: Cloud Forest
habitats.description: Moist, misty forests at high elevations, rich in biodiversity.

habitats.name: Urban Park
habitats.description: Green spaces within cities, providing habitat for urban wildlife.

habitats.name: Salt Marsh
habitats.description: Coastal wetlands with salt-tolerant plants, important for shorebirds.

habitats.name: Rice Paddy
habitats.description: Flooded fields used for rice cultivation, supporting aquatic life.

habitats.name: Pine Barren
habitats.description: Ecosystems dominated by pine trees and sandy soils.

habitats.name: Highland Plateau
habitats.description: Elevated flatlands with unique vegetation and fauna.

habitats.name: Crater Lake
habitats.description: Volcanic calderas filled with pristine water, supporting native species.

habitats.name: Hot Spring
habitats.description: Natural springs with geothermally heated water, hosting thermophilic organisms.

habitats.name: Oxbow Lake
habitats.description: Curved lakes formed from old river meanders, rich in aquatic life.

habitats.name: Oil Spill Area
habitats.description: Locations impacted by oil spills, requiring cleanup and restoration.

habitats.name: Salt Cave
habitats.description: Underground caves with salt deposits, home to unique adaptations.

habitats.name: Wildflower Meadow
habitats.description: Open areas filled with native wildflowers, vital for pollinators.

habitats.name: Quarry
habitats.description: Excavation sites with rocky terrain, often repurposed for nature conservation.

habitats.name: Coral Atoll
habitats.description: Ring-shaped coral reef formations with central lagoons.

habitats.name: Geological Fissure
habitats.description: Narrow openings in the Earth's crust, sometimes harboring unique life.

habitats.name: Bog
habitats.description: Waterlogged areas with acidic peat soil and specialized flora.
